When you click Salt Lake City in the view, to where will the URL action direct you?

questions.question_text: How can you select a non-default shape palette?

choices.B: Click the drop-down menu at the top of the Marks card to change from Automatic
choices.D: From the Data Source tab, select Connect to Data to import other shape palettes
choices.A: Select Shape on the Marks card and use the drop-down menu in the Edit Shape dialog box
choices.C: From the File menu, select Import Workbook to import other shape palettes

To remove all sorts in the view, open the menu next to the clear sheet icon in the toolbar and select Clear Sorts. Alternatively, go to Worksheet > Clear > Sorts.
https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/sortgroup_sorting_computed_howto.htm
I think the right answer is A

questions.question_text:
You have a visualization that uses multiple types of sorting.
How can you clear all sorting of the visualization?

choices.B: Right-click a sorted field, and then select Clear Sort.
choices.D: From the Header label, select the sort icon.
choices.C: From the Worksheet menu, select Clear, and then select Sorts.
choices.A: From the Dashboard menu, select Clear.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A & B. Created some dummy data with all three. Date and Date/Time when double clicked to the shelf has a hierarchy starting with year, quarter etc. City state zip or just city will add lat and long to the columns and rows shelf, while state or zip will simply present discrete dimensions. Google AI and any other answer is ignorant.

comments.content: Tableau automatically creates hierarchies for all date fields in your source data. This way, you can easily break the dates down into year, quarter, month, etc
